publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2612.1 Sarah Boyack: Congratulations to Pat Cox MEP—As an amendment to motion (S1M-2612) in the name of Mr Lloyd Quinan, leave out from "members" to end and insert "only Scottish candidate, David Martin MEP, on his substantial vote and on being re-elected Vice President; commends those Labour MEPs who stood up for Scotland by voting for Scotland’s candidate, and notes that the Scottish National Party has chosen to put the interests of Ireland above those of Scotland."

S1M-2612.1 Sarah Boyack: Congratulations to Pat Cox MEP-As an amendment to motion (S1M-2612) in the name of Mr Lloyd Quinan, leave out from "members" to end and insert "only Scottish candidate, David Martin MEP, on his substantial vote and on being re-elected Vice President; commends those Labour MEPs who stood up for Scotland by voting for Scotland's candidate, and notes that the Scottish National Party has chosen to put the interests of Ireland above those of Scotland."
S1M-2612.1 Congratulations to Pat Cox MEP (lodged on 17 January 2002) Bristow Muldoon*

S1M-2612.1 Congratulations to Pat Cox MEP (lodged on 17 January 2002) Susan Deacon*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Margaret Jamieson*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Elaine Thomson*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Karen Whitefield*, Rhoda Grant*, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-2612.1 Congratulations to Pat Cox MEP (lodged on 17 January 2002) Mr Duncan McNeil*, Trish Godman*, Cathie Craigie*, Scott Barrie*, Karen Gillon*
S1M-2612.1 Congratulations to Pat Cox MEP (lodged on 17 January 2002) Mr John Home Robertson*, Rhona Brankin*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-2612.1 Congratulations to Pat Cox MEP (lodged on 17 January 2002) Angus MacKay*
S1M-2612.1 Congratulations to Pat Cox MEP (lodged on 17 January 2002) Helen Eadie*
S1M-2612.1 Congratulations to Pat Cox MEP (lodged on 17 January 2002) Jackie Baillie*
